content.description: The crack to the left of Bloodguard. Follow the crack up to the roof then pull the roof to the right of the small crack under the roof.
Nice wide crack with decent hands the whole way. Can often be wet, but is a good rout for those looking to climb wider cracks at an easier grade.
content.protection: Wider gear may be helpful for this to avoid a run out.
content.location: Climb the same start as Hyper Gamma Spaces, but stay left in the wide crack (crack to the direct right of Space Dwarves) when Hyper Gamma Spaces goes right onto the roof.

content.description: Straight forward and blocky arete, really fun one to hit since your top rope is gonna already be set up next to it
content.protection: standard rack or top rope, sling to boulders at top
content.location: Arete to the right of In Your Head.

content.description:
Start on same holds as Walk This Way, but continue direct through the first block roof instead of stepping left.  Follow the wide crack up left of the roof towards easier terrain.  Move towards the inside corner and climb the left-facing blocks to the flat platform at the top.  Good holds. 

  beta comes from "Climb Maryland!" by Mark "Indy" Kochte.
content.protection: top rope, possible trad lead.
content.location: Located at the Middle Earth Crag at Sugarloaf Mountain in Maryland, Space Dwarves is located just left of the obvious roof of Hyper Gamma Spaces.

content.description: Climb up the ramp under the Hyper-Gamma-Spaces roof.  Awkwardly stem and mantle your way up into the corner under the roof and delicately step right around the roof.  Once on the face, the climbing gets substantially easier.
content.protection:
I was able to place a #.75 and #2 C4 in the shallow flare in the bottom of the corner, before stepping of the ramp. Once up a little higher, I plugged a #.4 C4 in the small pod in the seam between the roof and the face.  You may be able to fit an offset nut in the seam instead (which would probably be a better placement).  Once around the corner there is more finger sized gear available if you want it.   

  Though you can place gear, the crux piece (#.4 C4) is in a very shallow pod.  I would not want to take a serious fall on it because if it does not hold, you will hit the ramp. 

  Can top rope this using same anchor as In Your Head.
content.location: Under the massive roof to the right of For Short People Only.

content.description: climb up and over the overhang/roof in the chimney, and find your self on a large ledge (you can also bypass the overhang by working your way around to the far left then moving back above it). follow the notch and crack to the right of "rhythm roof". try not to go to far right, as it's an easy way to avoid the crux. on a nice weekend be prepared to stand in line to climb this gem.
content.protection: A Std rack will work to lead this route. Gear or long slings to wrap the trees will work for your anchor.

content.description: To the right of Black Planet. It runs up the set of vertical flakes and through a fun roof pull. Its a contrived route which isnt very difficult but is good for practicing some off-nominal flake protection placements.
content.protection: TR anchor is set off 2 boulders at the top and drapes to a safe standing ledge.   TRAD: Small pieces, also a 1 or 2 for the last piece while topping out.
content.location: To the right of Black Planet. Runs the right side of the rock.

content.description: Climb up under the roof angling right to a notch and up and over. There are big jugs above the lip.
content.protection: Can be top roped, no fixed gear.

content.description: Climb the face just LEFT of the 'White Quartz Wielder' route, finish on left side of roof.
content.protection: Top Rope
content.location: Middle Earth, left of White Quartz Wielder

content.description:
The crux is protecting and pulling the roof.  This is a three move high ball boulder problem, which if done on lead is uber heady because the pro below the roof that you can get isn't that good. 

  Would not recommend this route for newer trad leaders.
content.protection: Brassy nut below the roof, #1 above.  Build an anchor at the top.
content.location: To the right of Hyper-Gamma-Spaces roof. Look for the weakness in the roof on the face.

content.description: The route starts off in a small chimney that narrows toward the top. This is the crux of the route. Once you pass the chimney the route is an easy, slabby climb.
content.protection: Top rope

content.description: Start at the corner under the main roof.  Move up and through the blocky roof between the crack-traverses of Space Dwarves and Shadow Warrior, using thin cracks to gain easier terrain up high.  The climb is basically done after the roof, with ledges and blocks finishing the route.
content.protection: top rope, possible trad lead
content.location: At Middle Earth in Sugarloaf Mountain, find the blocky roof between Space Dwarves and Shadow Warrior.

content.description: This climb starts with a dynamic move off of one of two underclings to a wide horizontal pocket/rail. Traversing left on your hands your next move is to a fingerlock on the left. Using and hands or feet on the boulder in the down climb to climber's left brings this down to a 5.9+. Continue to the top.
content.protection: Standard rack but be prepared to runout out the bottom or place gear blindly in the first horizontal rail.
content.location: On the green face around the corner from butterfingers and across the descent gully from the bloodguard face.

content.description: An excellent route for beginners on toprope, or for beginning trad leaders.  The first 20 feet are the hardest part.  There is a microwave-sized loose block midway up the boulder that is a little sketchy to stand on.
content.protection: Takes plenty of gear, standard (small) rack will work.  Boulders at the top work for a toprope.
content.location: Left of the Hyper-Gamma-Spaces roof, this is the first (rightmost) crack.

content.description: Climb the crack system to the right of Bloodguard. Easy climbing. Great for new trad leaders to practice on.There's an additional 5.6 variation that traverses left under the first roof to the Bloodguard line and shares an anchor with it.
content.protection: Standard rack

content.description: The Cave Route is fun and can get pretty tight near the top. Climbing with a pack is not the best idea. The crux is certainly at the top of the cave where you have to squeeze your way out. There is a good belay anchor off a tree trunk to belay your partner up if needed. The remainder of the climb is class 4. Roping up is opitional for the half ass second pitch.
content.protection: Not much gear required at all. Great tree trunk anchor at the top of the cave. Thats it!
content.location: Sugarloaf Mt, Middle Earth area, directly to the right of the 5.6 Seven Wishes.

content.description:
Start as for Butterfingers. Instead of taking the crack straight up after pulling the crux roof, work right on the slab and climb the thin dihedral through another roof. Easy finish to the top from there. 

  Adds another delicate/awkward crux to Butterfingers on thin holds and good smears.
content.protection: Mostly small gear (.1 - .5) with some bigger stuff for building an anchor at the top.

content.description: Climb the broken blocky arete through a series of roofs to the top. Another variation climbs the face to the right and traverses left to the arete following a horizontal crack that regularly opens up creating deep jugs.
content.protection: Standard rack.
content.location: To the right of the bloodguard face and to the left of Seven Wishes.

content.description: Start at the center of a blank face, move up to a quartz vein then move left to a broken crack system. Hand traverse back right at the ledge, then move up through a fun series of small roofs.
content.protection: Top rope-able. The run out section is in the first 15' of the route.
content.location: This is the leftmost area of Middle Earth. Head right before concrete steps adjacent to the Pillar, then scramble up through a small boulder field to the base of the climb.

content.description: Real fun face Climb! a bald patch left of a purple splotch midwall is the crux (arete off)... tons of variations to make this easier.
content.protection: Top rope preferred as there are very few cracks but trad is possible, small pro
content.location: Right of Sugarloaf Arete, start below large purple splotch on the middle of the wall and work up and left, passing on left side of purple splotch (not using the arete) and then back slightly right as you climb over the little roof... scramble the last section and then there is a trail down to the left of the wall

content.description: The first 30 feet are classic.  After you get past the flake, it becomes a 5.2 walk-up.
content.protection: Good trad gear.  New leaders may find the crux (pulling the flake) a bit daunting.  Small cams will help.
content.location: From the huge Hyper-Gamma-Spaces roof, look left.  This is the second obvious crack, with a prominent flake about 20-30 feet up.

content.description:
Start to the right of the cave under a roof and a right leaning crack that goes out to the arête.  Follow the crack and turn the corner onto the face.  Move up to beneath a small overhang and work out left around the overhang.  Cruise up easier rock to the top. 

  Often overlooked but a great route that protects fairly well, though the moves left around the overhang will have you above your gear a bit.
content.protection: Cams and nuts to 1".  Only reason for anything bigger is for an anchor at the top if you want them.
content.location: Right of the cave where I Am A Cam is located.

content.description: From the green trail this is the first wall you come to on your right. at 120 feet of broken rock cliff that one can find climbs upwards of 50 feet (most average 30 to 40 though). This area is prone to the ravens closure, as they like to nest on Butterfingers.
